definition: one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
pinyin: dang1 ju2 zhe3 mi2 , pang2 guan1 zhe3 qing1

sentences.english: He was repaid for his conscientious anxiety in the character of a spectator.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個旁觀者，他那從良心出發的焦慮得到了補償。

sentences.english: There is a looker-on who sits behind my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 有一個旁觀者，坐在我的眼睛後面。

sentences.english: A number of Mexican soldiers and by- standers were wounded.
sentences.chinese: 一些墨西哥士兵和旁觀者受傷。

sentences.english: Lookers-on all feels to be afraid very much.
sentences.chinese: 旁觀者都感到十分害怕。

sentences.english: The three spectators seemed quite stupefied.
sentences.chinese: 三個旁觀者完全驚呆了。

sentences.english: Beauty is in the eyes of the beholders.
Definitely a looker wouldn't you say?
sentences.chinese: 絕對是一個旁觀者不會你說什麼？

sentences.english: The whole self is the observer and the participator in the roles.
sentences.chinese: 全我是旁觀者，也是角色的參與者。

sentences.english: And for those on the sidelines without a job it's a troubling requirement.
sentences.chinese: 對那些沒有工作的旁觀者來說，這是一個濁度需求。

sentences.english: Fortunately, none of the zoo officials or bystanders were hurt orangutan .
sentences.chinese: 幸好動物保護官及旁觀者無人受傷。

sentences.english: The spectators dropped off to get refreshment .
sentences.chinese: 旁觀者紛紛離座去喫點心。
拍攝時的旁觀者也要帶上手銬了。

sentences.english: McMullen performed CPR while other bystanders called 911.
sentences.chinese: 麥克馬倫進行人工呼吸，其他旁觀者則打了911。

sentences.english: A spectator can even opt to remove the fog of war altogether for a truly global view of the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 從一個旁觀者的身份，可以破開任何一處的戰爭迷霧。

sentences.english: It would be best if only one bystander responded, the thinking goes.
sentences.chinese: 基於這樣的考慮，最好只有一個旁觀者來作出反應。

sentences.english: McFerrin said bystanders converged on the scene trying to get a glimpse of the actor.
sentences.chinese: 麥克菲林說，旁觀者融合在現場試圖獲得一瞥演員。

definition: to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to remove/to step back from involvement/to disengage
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
